1996, </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adobe_Flash" title="Adobe Flash" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adobe_Flash" data-cms-link-type="external">Flash</a><span> (originally known as FutureSplash) was developed. At the time, the Flash content development tool was relatively simple compared to now, using basic layout and drawing tools, a limited precursor to </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ActionScript" title="ActionScript" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ActionScript" data-cms-link-type="external">ActionScript</a><span>, and a timeline, but it enabled web designers to go beyond the point of HTML, </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graphics_Interchange_Format#Animated_GIF" title="Graphics Interchange Format" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graphics_Interchange_Format#Animated_GIF" data-cms-link-type="external">animated GIFs</a><span> and </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JavaScript" title="JavaScript" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JavaScript" data-cms-link-type="external">JavaScript</a><span>. However, because Flash required a </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plug-in_(computing)" title="Plug-in (computing)" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plug-in_(computing)" data-cms-link-type="external">plug-in</a><span>, many web developers avoided using it for fear of limiting their market share due to lack of compatibility. Instead, designers reverted to gif animations (if they didn't forego using </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motion_graphics" title="Motion graphics" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motion_graphics" data-cms-link-type="external">motion graphics</a><span> altogether) and JavaScript for </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_widget" title="Software widget" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_widget" data-cms-link-type="external">widgets</a><span>. But the benefits of Flash made it popular enough among specific target markets to eventually work its way to the vast majority of browsers, and powerful enough to be used to develop entire sites.</span></p>"},"expanded":true,"description":"","ghostContainer":false,"visibleFormGroups":["9b68effe-95e3-4c14-9582-82b370ee7f74"],"templateUnitId":"MUNIT-15d022ab-3554-4505-9303-a992030779d2-MUNIT","id":"MUNIT-5215db04-1656-49e6-968a-4c562f44f794-MUNIT","inserted":true,"insideGhost":false,"children":[{"moduleId":"rz_style_font","name":"","formValues":{"cssEnableLetterSpacing":{"type":"bp","default":false},"cssEnableLineHeight":{"type":"bp","default":true},"cssLineHeight":{"type":"bp","default":"175%"},"cssEnableFontSize":{"type":"bp","[object 1998 Netscape released Netscape Communicator code under an </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open-source_license" title="Open-source license" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Open-source_license" data-cms-link-type="external">open source licence</a><span>, enabling thousands of developers to participate in improving the software. However, they decided to start from the beginning, which guided the development of the open source browser and soon expanded to a complete application platform. </span><span>The </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_Standards_Project" title="Web Standards Project" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_Standards_Project" data-cms-link-type="external">Web Standards Project</a><span> was formed and promoted browser compliance with </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_layout_engines_(HTML)" title="Comparison of layout engines (HTML)" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_layout_engines_(HTML)" data-cms-link-type="external">HTML</a><span> and </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_layout_engines_(Cascading_Style_Sheets)" title="Comparison of layout engines (Cascading Style Sheets)" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comparison_of_layout_engines_(Cascading_Style_Sheets)" data-cms-link-type="external">CSS</a><span> standards by creating </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid1" title="Acid1" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid1" data-cms-link-type="external">Acid1</a><span>, </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid2" title="Acid2" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid2" data-cms-link-type="external">Acid2</a><span>, and </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid3" title="Acid3" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Acid3" data-cms-link-type="external">Acid3</a><span> tests. 2000 was a big year for Microsoft. Internet Explorer was released for Mac; this was significant as it was the first browser that fully supported HTML 4.01 and CSS 1, raising the bar in terms of standards compliance. It was also the first browser to fully support the </span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portable_Network_Graphics" title="Portable Network Graphics" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Portable_Network_Graphics" data-cms-link-type="external">PNG</a><span> image format.</span><span> During this time Netscape was sold to</span><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AOL" title="AOL" data-cms-link="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AOL" data-cms-link-type="external">AOL</a><span> and this was seen as Netscape’s official loss to Microsoft in the browser wars.</span></p>"},"expanded":true,"description":"","ghostContainer":false,"visibleFormGroups":["9b68effe-95e3-4c14-9582-82b370ee7f74"],"templateUnitId":"MUNIT-15d022ab-3554-4505-9303-a992030779d2-MUNIT","id":"MUNIT-a0f77dcd-95f7-4518-babd-f5b62347ffbf-MUNIT","inserted":true,"insideGhost":false,"children":[{"moduleId":"rz_style_font","name":"","formValues":{"cssEnableLetterSpacing":{"type":"bp","default":false},"cssEnableLineHeight":{"type":"bp","default":true},"cssLineHeight":{"type":"bp","default":"175%"},"cssEnableFontSize":{"type":"bp","[object
